title: Creating Ground-to-Air Emergency Symbols
brief: Make standardized ground symbols that pilots can easily recognize and understand.
steps: Step 1: Make symbols minimum 1 meter wide and 6 meters long.
Step 2: For larger symbols, maintain the same 1:6 width-to-length ratio.
Step 3: Ensure symbol contrasts greatly with the ground background.
Step 4: Place in open area easily spotted from air.
Step 5: Use materials like rocks, logs, clothing, or dig trenches to form symbols.
Step 6: Learn the 5 standard symbols: I (need doctor), II (need medical supplies), X (unable to proceed), F (need food and water), arrow (proceeding in this direction).
warnings: Symbols must have high contrast to be visible from aircraft altitude.
Don't make symbols in areas where enemy can easily observe them.
Symbols are meaningless if not made to proper proportions.
